c74object.name: ta.wrap
c74object.digest: Wrap input numbers between a given range
c74object.description: Wrap input number streams between two given boundaries (minimum, maximum). When the input number exceeds the maximum value, it will wrap down, starting from the minima and incrising. If the input exceeds the minimum value,the object will wrap numbers up, starting from the maxima and decreasing.

objarg.name: minimum
objarg.description: The minimum value is the lower limit to the range of output values allowed. If only one argument is present, it is used as both the minimum and maximum limit. If no argument is present, the minimum and maximum limit is 0.

objarg.name: maximum
objarg.description: The maximum value is the upper limit to the range of output values allowed. If only one argument is present, it is used as both the minimum and maximum limit. If no argument is present, the minimum and maximum limit is 0.

method.name: int
method.description: The number is sent out the outlet, wrapped within the minimum and maximum limits specified by the minimum and maximum limits. The ta.wrap object doesn't adapt the wrapped output values to its input, so an integer input value will output a floataing point value regardless of the numeric type specified as an argument.

method.name: float
method.description: The number is sent out the outlet, wrapped within the minimum and maximum limits. The ta.wrap will always output floating point values regardless of the numeric type specified as an argument.

method.name: list
method.description: Each number in the list is wrapped within the minimum and maximum limits, and the folded numbers are sent out as a list.

method.name: set
method.description: The word set, followed by two numbers, resets the minimum and maximum limits.

attribute.name: maxsize
attribute.description: Maximum number of items to process. If the input list exceeds this size, excess items will be truncated.

entry.name: float
entry.description: Wrapped value within the specified minimum and maximum limits.

entry.name: list
entry.description: When a list is received in the inlet, each number is wrapped within the specified minimum and maximum limits, and the numbers are sent out as a list. Note that the list output is comprised of floating point values, even if there are integers in the input list.
